bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Bertha L. Lyons, May 4, 1948

div1.p: Hench replies to Lyons' letter and suggests editorial changes. He will arrive in New York on May 20th for the Hall of Fame event.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Bertha L. Lyons, May 4, 1948
div1.opener:
May 4, 1948
Miss Bertha L. Lyons
Hall of Fame:
New York University
1 Madison Avenue
New York 10, New York
My dear Miss Lyons:
div1.p:
Let me answer your letter of the thirtieth of April. Page 9 - editorials
from The Washington Post - your notes read, “The misapprehensions - - -”
is not the proper word. Would not the word misbelief or skepticism be
more appropriate? Page 15 - Congressional Medal - Although this is in
my possession, would it not be better to state “by courtesy of Mrs. Walter
Reed?”

I have received your nice invitation and I will arrive in New York at the
Hotel Waldorf about 10 o'clock in the morning of May twentieth. I would
appreciate it if you would let me know if I can catch one of your private
cars from down town.

I am glad to see that you have Miss Swarthout on the program. She is one
of my favorite singers. I have never met her and I think she is a wonderful
singer.
Mrs. Hench will not be along.
div1.closer: Sincerely, Philip S. Hench, M.D. psh:ct
